intro: Azorella fragosea, commonly known as the Chilean cushion plant, is a low-growing, mat-forming shrub native to the Andes of Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, clustered leaves. The plant is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments, often found in rocky soils and alpine regions. Its flowers are small and white, typically appearing in late spring to early summer. Azorella fragosea plays a significant role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various alpine organisms.
